summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of the alley in Block Sixty-one (61), A. A. Denny's Addition to the town (now City) of Seattle, same being the alley between Sixth Avenue and Seventh Avenue, from University Street to Union Street, by paving the same with vitrified brick, laid upon a proper concrete foundation, together with all sewers and appurtenances that may be necessary, in accordance with Resolution No. 698 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
